page.content:
*Info for Upcoming Event 2-19-11* * We will be using the white board to draw a live layout as we play. The layout will include what your players can see as well as enemy placement. At the beginning of your first turn in combat, you will designate your player's placement. * Please review your character BEFORE Saturday and the items and skills you have. This will allow our game to go smoothly. * We will NOT be leveling up Saturday since last session there was not much XP gained. This next session should provide enough to level up for next time. * Battle scenes need to go quicker. If you do not state your move after 5 seconds you allow the enemy to make an opportunity attack on you. Look over your moves BEFORE YOUR TURN! * More info may be added here before Saturday so check back a time or two.
* Total Defense - You can use this as your standard action, taking a +2 bonus to all defenses until your next turn. * You may kill or knock unconscious any enemy when he reaches 0 hit points * We need to transition into more vivid battle scenes. Use descriptive and exciting language.
* On skill checks that do not have a drastic outcome you may Take 10 instead of rolling * You can make a Bluff check once per encounter to gain combat advantage on your next attack. It's called a feint. * Intimidation checks need clarification. They are rarely threats against someone's life. They are more of an _implied threat_. Example: You intimidate a baron by having your largest ally stare angrily into his eyes while you talk to him. * We will have a Q&A session before our next game regarding all the skills and how to use them. * Remember we are ROLE PLAYING. Do what your character would do...not you. Unless your character is Evil alignment he would not kill a person because of an argument.

page.title: Gardmore Abbey
page.content:
_Set in a hillside, Gardmore Abbey is made of light-colored stone. It has become overgrown with grass, flowers, and various plant-life. Pieces of the structure stick out of the hill in random places and broken columns lie all around. There are a few walls with windows and a grand opening in the center of the largest wall._
# There is a large, blue circle in the stone floor with a picture of a silver dragon on it. *A Religion DC 15 will allow them to recognize Bahamut* Three sets of wooden double doors are here. The doors on the right are cracked open and voices can be heard from inside. # Level 6 Orc encounter minus wolves. MM pg. 205 # A Perception DC 22 or 25 notices a missing stone in the corner wall. Reaching inside and pulling a lever will open the wall revealing a treasure chest. It contains 200 gp and a Cloak of Resistance. See PH 250 # The picture of the dragon under the altar is the only thing not covered in dust. It shines like new and appears to be glass. Shattering it will reveal a hole leading down into the lower levels with a rope. # In this study, the PCs find a scroll on the desk. It reads, _It remains safe in the deep under praises to almighty Bahamut_ # In this study, the PCs find a scroll on the desk. It reads, _We praise you almighty Bahamut. Beneath your wings and testament, you keep it safe._ # A large, ornate wall has some writing on in. It is in Common. It reads, _Strike Twice, Declare His Majesty, and Enter_ # There is a blue sword on the far wall guarded by a Rage Drake (MM 92) and 3 Orc Warriors (MM 203) # There is a silver sword on the far wall guarded by 2 Orc Warriors and an Orc Chieftain (MM 205) # An altar is covered in dust. It is draped over with a blue cloth that reaches to the ground. The shape of a wing can be seen on the altar as if an item were removed not long ago. Under the altar, behind the cloth lies a Bag of Holding containing Moonbane. _Moonbane is a Thundering Longsword (PH 236)_

Set in a hillside, Gardmore Abbey is made of light-colored stone. It has become overgrown with grass, flowers, and various plant-life. Pieces of the structure stick out of the hill in random places and broken columns lie all around. There are a few walls with windows and a grand opening in the center of the largest wall.

  1. There is a large, blue circle in the stone floor with a picture of a silver dragon on it. A Religion DC 15 will allow them to recognize Bahamut Three sets of wooden double doors are here. The doors on the right are cracked open and voices can be heard from inside.
  2. Level 6 Orc encounter minus wolves. MM pg. 205
  3. A Perception DC 22 or 25 notices a missing stone in the corner wall. Reaching inside and pulling a lever will open the wall revealing a treasure chest. It contains 200 gp and a Cloak of Resistance. See PH 250
  4. The picture of the dragon under the altar is the only thing not covered in dust. It shines like new and appears to be glass. Shattering it will reveal a hole leading down into the lower levels with a rope.
  5. In this study, the PCs find a scroll on the desk. It reads, It remains safe in the deep under praises to almighty Bahamut
  6. In this study, the PCs find a scroll on the desk. It reads, We praise you almighty Bahamut. Beneath your wings and testament, you keep it safe.
  7. A large, ornate wall has some writing on in. It is in Common. It reads, Strike Twice, Declare His Majesty, and Enter
  8. There is a blue sword on the far wall guarded by a Rage Drake (MM 92) and 3 Orc Warriors (MM 203)
  9. There is a silver sword on the far wall guarded by 2 Orc Warriors and an Orc Chieftain (MM 205)
  10. An altar is covered in dust. It is draped over with a blue cloth that reaches to the ground. The shape of a wing can be seen on the altar as if an item were removed not long ago. Under the altar, behind the cloth lies a Bag of Holding containing Moonbane.
    Moonbane is a Thundering Longsword (PH 236)

page.title: Fallcrest
page.content: Fallcrest is a town in the center of the Nentir Vale. The inhabitants are mostly humans, halflings, and a few tieflings and dwarves. There is plenty going on in this farming and supply town. !http://cdn.obsidianportal.com/assets/33540/Fallcrest.jpg(Fallcrest)!
Fallcrest is a town in the center of the Nentir Vale. The inhabitants are mostly humans, halflings, and a few tieflings and dwarves. There is plenty going on in this farming and supply town.

page.title: The town of Fallcrest
page.content:
The adventurers had Teldorthan Ironhew fashion them a duplicate of Moonbane using one of the two magic shortswords. He was allowed to keep the other for compensation. He refuses to forge the Markelhay symbol on it. He wants to keep his good name.
1. Tower of Waiting - This tower is mere ruins by now. *Streetwise DC 15 reveals that a ghost of an evil princess lives beneath the tower, haunting it since its end. Word is that she dabbled in demon worship* See dungeon. 2. Upper Quays - [[:barstomun-strongbeard | Barstomun Strongbeard]] runs the porters' guild and takes a cut of any wages paid to laborers carrying cargo up or down the falls. He is extending his reach with his gang of thugs. They rip off merchants who must send their goods across land. 3. Five-Arch Bridge - Wooden bridge built over the stone remains of the first that was built by dwarves in Hammerfast. 4. Nentir Inn - Proprietor is a charming half-elf named [[:erandil-zemoar | Erandil Zemoar]]. The money used for the inn wasn't his. He charmed a noblewoman in the south and fled the authorities. 5. Knight's Gate - It's run by [[:sergeant-nereth | Sergeant Nereth]] who rigorously enforces all rules. The guards can't stand him! He would be most pleased to take care of bad news himself but he cannot leave his post. He doesn't understand why the PCs haven't done anything yet. "That's against the law! Why haven't you stopped them?!" 6. Silver Unicorn Inn - "the Pride of Fallcrest" as it is called charges high rates. Owned by a stern halfling named [[:wisara-osterman | Wisara Osterman]]. She doesn't like Erandil and can't put her finger on what is bad about him. 7. Halfmoon Trading House - [[:selarund-halfmoon | Selarund Halfmoon]] runs this place. He is friendly and dispenses an unending stream of advice such as, "It never rains but as someone gets wet!" or "A nail ain't afraid of a hammer with no handle!" No one knows what he's talking about most of the time. He sells mundane tools, gear, supplies, or clothing mentioned in the PH. 8. Moonstone Keep - This keep is the home of the Markelhays. The Tombwood - This forest has never been cleared. In the middle is an old graveyard dating back centuries. These old crypts are linked by secret passages to dungeons under Moonstone Keep. The Markelhays were master trap builders so the dungeons will be dangerous! But no doubt there will be treasure! 10. House of the Sun - temple dedicated to Pelor that was abandoned. It also includes shrines to Kord and Bahamut. Recently, a zealous dwarf priest from Hammerfast named [[:grundelmar | Grundelmar]] came to reestablish this place. He worships Pelor. He is loud and opinionated and fire-mouthed always talking about smiting evil. He worries about Trade Road and asks you to search out the Raven Roost lair. 11. House Azaer - High priced mundane equipment from PH. They run a nice trading company. Run by Tieflings of the Azaer family. Amara Azaer runs the business in Fallcrest. She is young but sharp and doesn't miss opportunities to make money. 12. The Nentir Falls - 200 feet of three shelf-like drops. On the small island in the middle of the falls stands the statue of an ancient human hero named Vendar, holding up his hand as if to challenge enemies approaching from downriver. Local legend tells that Vendar slew a dragon whose lair was hidden in the caverns beneath the falls. 13. Temple of Erathis - Largest and most influential in town. Also has shrines to Ioun and Moradin. Run by High Priest Dirina Mornbrow. She is convinced of Erathis's dogma. For a gift to him, she can help with ritual magic. 14. Bluffs - 150-200 ft. tall 15. The Catacombs - Rumors say that in the deepest caverns lie treasure guarded by the undead. But they are deep, deep within. 16. Moonsong Temple - Devoted to Sehanine. Naerumar's Imports - this fine place deals in jewelry, art, and magic trinkets. The owner is Orest Naerumar, a tiefling with impeccable manners and discretion. page.title: Beneath Moonstone Keep
page.content: # A skeleton lies lifeless in the corner of this room. Searching the skeleton reveals nothing. # This room has four knights on each of the side walls. The stone on the ground before the room reads, _The great and mighty knight, though banished in the light, here in the darkness remain anything but harmless._ The dark squares will trigger a flurry of darts. Everyone in the room takes 1d6 damage. Then they make an Athletics DC 15 check. Failure results in an additional 3 damage. The light squares are safe. They require an Acrobatics DC 15 to successfully maneuver across. # This room has a 15 foot pit. On the other side, there are creatures that can shoot ranged shots. The gap requires an Athletics 15. Falling in the pit the PC takes 5 damage and must roll an Athletics 15 to climb out. # This thin bridge requires an Acrobatics 15 to get across. Falling will result in a d10 damage roll. # The weapons rack in this room appears rusty and old. The two gargoyles in the back corners appear to be watching it. Should the PCs touch the weapons rack, the gargoyles breathe fire dealing 5 fire damage # There are five pictures on the wall. The picture on the left is of a tree. Behind it is a chest containing 500 gp. The main wall has three pictures. The left one is an old woman with a cane. The middle on is a dragon adorned in fine jewelry. The right one is a Wyvern flying across the moon. The stone on the floor in the entrance reads, _"Treasures are best kept safe by those who walk on four legs in the morning, two in the afternoon, and three in the evening."_ The correct picture is the lady. The treasure chest contains Burglar's Gloves. (PH 247) The other two lead to the following encounter: The room shakes with a horrible violence and the entrance suddenly caves in. The left and right wall begin to move toward each other. The players can attempt to stop the wall with a Strength tin DC 25. The other option is to open a side picture or the main one to get out. Failure results in PCs being knocked unconscious to 0 hit points. The picture on the right wall is of another tree. It leads to a secret passage. # This room contains a giant statue (titan statue) made of stone. It appears to be wearing an actual belt of some sort. If the PCs attempt to grab the belt the statue swings its mighty sword. The belt it is wearing is the Belt of Vigor (PH 253). # Footprints in the dust lead to a door. But none lead away. The stone door appears shut and sealed. An inscription is upon it: _A mighty beast, the air is in its lungs. No mouth, yet it has tongues. It does not live, yet it breathes. When the food is gone, it leaves. It will die from one drink. It can even cause the mighty ship to sink._ The word "fire" spoken aloud causes the door to glow red and open. A winding staircase leads down and down and down into a giant cavern where lava flows beneath the rocks. A single chest lies at the far end of a large rock platform. Once the PCs step onto it...the roaring dragon arises!

page.title: Raven Roost
page.content: # This room is occupied by 4 Shadar-Kai Gloomblades. (MM 230) There is a scattering of worthless objects and a bag containing 200 gp. # This is the kitchen. A stove is boiling something awful-smelling. The cabinets are loaded with food. # This study contains a scroll of a journal entry. Written in Common it says, _I never forget the day we lost Samminel...we were only out looting a caravan from Hammerfast when the stranger approached from Fallcrest. He resembled the fabled Eladrin of the Fey. Travelling by himself, he made for a ripe target. He began to defend himself and suddenly it appeared as though great and magic wings grew from his back. We backed down but Samminel was too stubborn. The Eladrin took no effort in his quick victory. The wings disappeared and the stranger went on his way. Samminel had been struck down by the traveler. I will never forget. If he passes through here again...it will be for the last time._ # Three large chairs sit ahead in this room. Two are occupied. Two guards also stand awaiting to fight. Erzoun cannot take her eyes of of the Eladrin PC. Two Shadar-kai Warriors, Sadar-kai Witch (Erzoun), Shadar-kai Chainfighter (Geriesh). (MM pg. 231) Erzoun has on her the address of a man named Barton who lives near Hammerfast.

page.title: The Catacombs
page.content: # These three rooms contain the sarcophagi of three great dwarf warriors from the Bloodspear War. They have been named by their ancestors as Valor, Courage, and Wisdom. Upon closer look, the sarcophagi of Wisdom is not fixed into the ground. page.title: Campaign Journal
page.content:
Three strangers met in a violent electrical storm. Courting storm-peace, they sought shelter in a nearby Tor, where they were forced to work together to defeat the monsters within. From there they headed to Stallcroft where a wizard told them they needed to go to the Misty Kingdom. They journeyed through a mountain where they met dwarves, fought a dragon, and found an interesting scroll that spoke of a great being named Starfire. The adventurers continued on to the Misty Kingdom where they liberated it from the evil grips of Lord Kalarel. From there they sought out the Feywild which they were told appeared within the Realm of the Vines. The got there with the help of an elf friend and arrived at their destination, the fabled academy of Brightkeep. This library housed the largest collection of knowledge known to exist. They sought more information on Starfire. The head wizard told them to follow his trail which led to Fallcrest in the Nentir Vale. They set out to do this.
In Fallcrest, the adventurers rid the town of a small gang and an underground organization that was promoting illegal activities. They also defeated two dragons beneath the town and found great treasure in Fallcrest and the Gardmore Abbey. They sought out the town leader who left for Raywold. On their journey to Raywold they invaded Raven Roost and left no one alive. Once in Raywold, they were arrested on site and taken to the castle dungeon. [[:antoban-heroldi | Antoban Heroldi]] has requested a meeting with [[:prince-crudak | Prince Crudak]]. He is seeking the adventurers after learning they are in the Nentir Vale. The Prince is corrupt and decides to capture the PCs because they are too powerful. The Prince also keeps Heroldi distracted and oblivious to his plan. The PCs must escape the castle and find the underground resistance movement. Once they build up the resistance, they can overthrow the Prince and re-establish Raywold as a good place. To gain the trust of resistance leader [[:jabar-gimmen | Jabar Gimmen]], the PCs will have to recruit [[:gideon-warhammer | Gideon Warhammer]] for the cause. The PCs will then acquire the funds to re-establish the Wizard's Guild. With the Wizard's Guild online and Gideon Warhammer joining the resistance, they should be powerful enough to take down Prince Crudak for good.
h3. The Plot Thickens
Tensions are rising too high around the regions. Bael Turath is rumored to rise from the ashes in the deep southern regions. The dragonborn aim to stop this. The Nentir Vale is a disorganized mess of cities who cannot get along. Algoria prepares for war as they wish to revive the Nerathi Empire of old. Aestonia is split in three as they all attempt to gain power over the coveted region. The Western Edge is rumored to be preparing for war, as well. To top it off, all communications from the distant land of Greyhawk have been lost.
h3. Dark Times Ahead
Maransa will not accept the God's Chosen and will attack unless their stone is returned. The Rising Lands will gladly welcome the God's Chosen. King Heroldi sends a messenger that is intercepted by patrols near New Haven looking for the God's Chosen (specifically Baurus). Truthfully, the barbarians were only a distraction. Mindflayers have taken over the Misty Kingdom. The Cascades will be a hopeless attempt without Vengeance. Baurus is actually aware of this and working on it.
h3. Starfire
Starfire is no wizard but he is wise in the way of magic. He is also a genius. His project nears completion.
h3. Underdark
[[The Sanctuary of Kings]] is an entrance to the Underdark. The players may need to solve the problem that this allows Maransa to come from behind in the battle at the Bleeding Edge.
Minora also serves as an entrance to the Underdark. This is where the Mind Flayers came from.
h3. Recapturing the Misty Kingdom
Mind flayers have taken over. What will the players do?
h3. The Seekers are battered and destroyed...
Gauthak's body is recovered by troops sent in to search for him. The barbarian shaman was able to bring Gauthak back but with great sacrifice. The next harvest of the Kinn Su was sacrificed to bring their glorious new leader back to life. He is injured... Lomian and Astrid face a much worse fate. The mind flayers found themselves two new slaves. The two were taken deep down into the Underdark near the elder brain. They gather stones (to reinforce a massive cavern) to help create a fortress for the elder brain. Their gear has been sacrificed to the great pit of acid. Lomian's new halo of fallen stars remains about his head. His sword is also safe (but where?). Astrid has lost almost everything.
[[:widgeon | Widgeon]] turns out to be [[:widera-kalrunn | Widera-Kalrunn]]. This mithral dragon has been trying to restructure the power in the world and bring civilization to its peak in Aestonia.
[[:starfire | Starfire]] has discovered the ramifications of his unleashing the Gaze into Astral space. Luckily, the wormhole closed after the Gaze ended and a heroic ship eliminated the mind-flayer threat. He is not aware that this Far Realm crossover had awoken [[:yahlrisik-ul | Yahlrisik-Ul]] and resulted in the almost utter destruction of Asalia.
The Gaze has been turned towards the world as Erathis was displeased by the "misfire" into the Astral Sea. Starfire is also pleased by the war in Aestonia and hopes that it will create a collapse that he may enter in and rebuild the Nerathi Empire.

page.title: Behind the Nentir Falls
page.content: Climbing up the ladder behind the falls leads the characters up 75 feet onto a large platform. There are layered surroundings that look like they can be climbed. The edges of the main platform will collapse if a character stops on them. *DC 15 Dexterity Check to catch ledge* Failing to catch the ledge will result in the character plummeting into the waters below. It takes 5 rounds to get back up to the platform. *DC 15 Athletics checks will allow players to scale the rocks to higher ground* There is a treasure chest with 1500 gp. There is also a Lvl 10 Holy Symbol of Battle (PH 237) with Lvl 11 Magic Cloth armor (PH 230).

page.title: Raywold
page.content:
Lord Markelhay has left town. His departure was unannounced and his destination unknown. His butler has a note that reads:
_Dearest Carter, Hammerfast is overextended yet picks up the trail, Many treks north and you need not a sail. Tis here I make my destination for an urgent matter. And be wary of a Gnome full of bumbling chatter. He arrived yesterday in search of those travelers so queer, They appear to him to be very, very dear. His intentions were noble but his words a mess. He resembles royalty in the way of his dress. Be warned, dearest Carter, of shadowy folk, They seek only to break the yolk.
Best regards, Lord Markelhay_
Any of the dwarves in Fallcrest can identify the location on the note as Raywold, home of Prince Crudak. *History DC 15 - Prince Crudak is the official ruler of the Nentir Vale. It is common knowledge that he holds no real power in most areas other than the city of Raywold.*
Prince Crudak holds a meeting at the request of King Antoban Heroldi of the Misty Kingdom. King Heroldi is looking for the adventurers. Prince Crudak was a good man but has been swayed by dark forces. He realizes the potential of these adventurers and keeps Heroldi entertained while he instructs his guards to arrest the PCs on site.
Raywold Castle Dungeon # This hallway is guarded by 1 Human Guard lvl 7. The PCs must use creativity to escape their cells. The Guard has the keys to their cells only. A small drain in the corner leads to the drain in room 4. # This is the barracks for the guards. A horn lies on the table. # This room is the armory. All the PCs equipment is locked in the various lockers. There is only one bag with 2000 gp though. Two human lackeys lvl 7 stand watch. The desk holds all the keys. # This hallway is guarded by 1 Human Guard lvl 7. The PCs must use creativity to escape their cells. The Guard has the keys to their cells only. A small drain in the corner leads to the drain in room 1. # This room houses inmates from Raywold and the surrounding countryside. A lvl 7 Human Guard patrols the hallway. The 7 inmates are 3 halflings, 3 humans, and 1 elf. **SEE BELOW** # This torture chamber is guarded by two lvl 7 Human Berserkers. # This room is guarded by four lvl 5 Dragonborn Soldiers. One attempts to wake the dungeon leader by going into his room. # This is the dungeon leader's quarters. He is a Dragonborn Gladiator lvl 10 named Xavkas and a heavy sleeper. If the guard awakes him, he will escape via his secret door that leads to the barracks and attempt to blow the horn and leave the dungeon. If he is awoken by the PCs, he will obey their commands.
** Kalup - halfling merchant who was accused of robbery when his business picked up Morstadt - halfling farmer who refused to pay the third tax raise of the month Feney - halfling troublemaker, harmless nuisance Eldron - human trader whose caravan was robbed by guards Falor - associate of Eldron Keef - Traveler who asked too many questions Navar - imprisoned for being an elf
*Raywold Town* # Castle Raywold # Old Wizard's Guild # Bank # Mystic - [[:bersheev | Bersheev]] is a mystic clothed in black and purple robes. It sounds like a female but is ungendered. Bersheev never shows its eyes. It will reveal your future for 10 gp. Roll a d20. 1-5 is a weak but near future. 6-10 is a strong but near future. 11-15 is a weak distant future. 16-20 is a strong distant future. # Exterior Guard Houses # Raywold Shopping District # Shiner's Brewery - This brewery is on the upper end of the socioeconomic scale. Few people drink here and all are wealthy or nobles. # Belldrinker's Delight - This pub is for the common men in Raywold. It is usually busy and full of drunken men looking for a fight. # Dwarfton Corner - Gideon Warhammer and his companions run their own "mini town" complete with housing, grocer, and a superb blacksmith. # This is the home of an underground resistance movement. Jabar Gimmen is a human that has round up various elves, halflings, and humans to his cause to bring down Prince Crudak. # Docking Inn - The Inn used by the resistance to shack up new recruits # Raywold Inn - This is the common Inn in Raywold # Duprov's Finest - This is the lower socio-economic tavern in town. The commoners here are looked down upon by other citizens yet this tavern is much more relaxed and fun than Belldrinker's Delight. # Tonik's Tunics - this establishment has the finest clothing in the Nentir Vale
The PCs will be led to the home of Jabar Gimmen by some of the prisoners. They will need to acquire new clothing and leave ALL armor and clothing at Jabar's house with all their weapons. The guards are out looking for them.
*Raywold Encounters*
_Escape the Guard_ The PCs must succeed in 12 successes before 6 failures while escaping the guard. Acrobatics 19, Athletics 19, Perception 15 (+2,-2), Streetwise 23 Success leads to an escape where the PCs will find the resistance. Failure leads to a combat encounter and possible arrest.
_Joining the Resistance_ The PCs must succeed in 6 successes before 3 failures in a negotiation with [[:jabar-gimmen | Jabar Gimmen]]. Diplomacy DC 19, Bluff DC 19, History DC 15, Insight DC 19 Success allows the characters into the resistance movement. Failure leads to the next task.
_Recruit Gideon Warhammer_ The PCs must succeed in 8 successes before 4 failures in a negotiation with [[:gideon-warhammer | Gideon Warhammer]]. Diplomacy DC 19, Bluff DC 19, History DC 15, Insight DC 19 (Bauris = Diplomacy 15, History 0) Success results in Gideon and his followers joining the resistance. Failure is the opposite.
_Re-establish the Wizard's Guild_ The wizard's guild in Raywold has gone into reclusion. 10 years ago, Prince Crudak cut off all funding to the Guild and halting all their progress. [[:khalim | Khalim]] is the only wizard that is currently at the Guild. The Guild promises to assist the resistance movement but they need funding. The PCs will have to secure funding as well as recruit 2-3 wizards to get the Guild going again. Khalim tells them of a dungeon just outside of town but it will be too dangerous to leave town. A secret entrance lies in Dwarfton Corner. The money and wizard's will help get the Guild going again. They can provide magical items as well as magic firepower to overthrow Prince Crudak.
_Refer to Raywold Dungeon 2_ "In the shadows it waits, ever so daunting. Not a creature above can bear its haunting. In the darkness, many will go to die. The terror beneath Raywold, a tear to our eye." # This room contains a key. An encounter includes 1 Bloodweb Spiderswarm and 4 Deathjump Spiders. (MM 246) # This room also contains a key. An encounter includes 8 Deathjump Spiders. (MM 246) # The door has an engraving: "What lies beyond you may not know, but be sure the Underdark, be sure the Drow." # A dark cave is revealed beyond the door. A large rock column in the middle rises into the darkness above. On the other side of it is a stone door. When the PCs approach the stone door, a blade spider (MM 246) drops from the ceiling behind them. Two Drow Warriors approach from the darkness as well (MM 94). One of the Drow has a key to the room. Inside the room is a treasure chest with 10,000 gp.
Once the Wizard's Guild has the proper funds it will take at least 2-3 days to get back up and running. The PCs should explore Raywold during this time.
*Seizing Raywold Castle* [[:jabar-gimmen | Jabar Gimmen]] knows that taken the Castle from the outside will be impossible. Most of the guards dwell around the perimeter or in the guard houses. The PCs must sneak into the castle and lock it from the inside. They will then be able to take it by force. Crudak will need to publicly give up his power or the military will side with him. Jabar Gimmen has two ideas for getting inside the castle. The resistance can hold off the military by starting a mess around town and calling out the guard. The PCs must get in the castle.
Every hour the kitchen staff takes out the garbage. There are only two guards watching that door at a time but they are Dragonborn. One Dragonborn has a horn and if it sounds, it is likely that 5-10 guards/minions will show up. Inside, the kitchen staff will need to be calmed with negotiations. 6 successes before 3 failures. Failure will lead to the staff running in panic and possibly alerting guards. A guard on duty will stop the PCs in the hallway and ask, "Hello! Can I help you find something?" Two Dragonborn soldiers guard the top of the stairs. The next hallway is empty containing the windows from option 2.
The PCs could climb to the second story and enter through an open window. This would negate the need to navigate the first floor but they would have to seal off the second floor.
After that is the throne room. Four Dragonborn soldiers, a Dragonborn Gladiator, and Prince Crudak are in this room. King Heroldi, Markelhay, and Graster Arroway are also in here. Prince Crudak yells, "Seize the prisoners!" Heroldi yells, "What are you doing?!" Intense negotiation follows.
8 successes before 4 failures to convince Markelhay and Heroldi of Prince Crudak's evil. Success leads to Graster fighting with the PCs while failure leads to no help.

Raywold Castle Dungeon

  1. This hallway is guarded by 1 Human Guard lvl 7. The PCs must use creativity to escape their cells. The Guard has the keys to their cells only. A small drain in the corner leads to the drain in room 4.
  2. This is the barracks for the guards. A horn lies on the table.
  3. This room is the armory. All the PCs equipment is locked in the various lockers. There is only one bag with 2000 gp though. Two human lackeys lvl 7 stand watch. The desk holds all the keys.
  4. This hallway is guarded by 1 Human Guard lvl 7. The PCs must use creativity to escape their cells. The Guard has the keys to their cells only. A small drain in the corner leads to the drain in room 1.
  5. This room houses inmates from Raywold and the surrounding countryside. A lvl 7 Human Guard patrols the hallway. The 7 inmates are 3 halflings, 3 humans, and 1 elf. SEE BELOW
  6. This torture chamber is guarded by two lvl 7 Human Berserkers.
  7. This room is guarded by four lvl 5 Dragonborn Soldiers. One attempts to wake the dungeon leader by going into his room.
  8. This is the dungeon leader’s quarters. He is a Dragonborn Gladiator lvl 10 named Xavkas and a heavy sleeper. Roll a d20. 1-5 is a weak but near future. 6-10 is a strong but near future. 11-15 is a weak distant future. 16-20 is a strong distant future.
  5. Exterior Guard Houses

  9. Dwarfton Corner – Gideon Warhammer and his companions run their own “mini town” complete with housing, grocer, and a superb blacksmith.
  10. This is the home of an underground resistance movement. Jabar Gimmen is a human that has round up various elves, halflings, and humans to his cause to bring down Prince Crudak.
  11. Docking Inn – The Inn used by the resistance to shack up new recruits
  12. Raywold Inn – This is the common Inn in Raywold
  13. Duprov’s Finest – This is the lower socio-economic tavern in town. The commoners here are looked down upon by other citizens yet this tavern is much more relaxed and fun than Belldrinker’s Delight.
  14. Tonik’s Tunics – this establishment has the finest clothing in the Nentir Vale

page.title: New Strategy
page.content:
Updated 8-25-11
h3. Changes to Our Game
Here's a few changes to our game in the future: *XP* * Experience will need to be earned from now on. I will go 100% by the numbers. If you are 5 points short of leveling up...better luck next time. Fights will still be split up. You do something cool though and you may get a few more. XP will be given individually for traps, talking with people, finding key clues, etc. _I will award some mad XP for anyone who gives me 15 minutes of solid roleplaying without breaking character._ This will make the game more fun since it is an RPG (also see last paragraph) * I'm transitioning to Obsidian Portal as our campaign home. Use it to find info on places, people, or past events. You may even find something you didn't know... * Each session, I will designate 1 person to write the adventure log after the session on here. It can be as fancy or brief as you want it to be. If you do it, you will get a bonus prize for the next session. * If you changed your avatar on here and sent me a PM with a magic item level 19-20 that you wanted, you will also receive that in our next session. * If you create a wiki page (ask how if you need) related to your character, I will also reward you for that. Example: Max creates a page for Haramathur under characters, detailing his background and the story of the four warforged, he will receive a bonus prize for that. For a prize on this one, the page must be well thought out. * Under the wiki tab we have pages called [[Party Treasury | Party Treasury]] and [[Player Rewards | Player Rewards]]. Player rewards will be where I place your rewards and XP. You will need to update the Party Treasury page with what you have acquired and spent.
I think our games can be _so much better_ if we begin describing the environment (my job) and battles (our jobs) in a deeper and more vivid way. Also, outside of combat, remember that your options for what to do are near limitless. This is your world that you shape and can do anything in. Let's get away from the usual "Metagame" thinking and start roleplaying more. Your decisions should be based on your character and less on what you as a real person would do. I'm going to do my best to facilitate this because I know it will make our games much more enjoyable and easily more epic.

Updated 8-25-11

Changes to Our Game

Here’s a few changes to our game in the future:
XP

  • Experience will need to be earned from now on. I will go 100% by the numbers. If you are 5 points short of leveling up…better luck next time. Fights will still be split up. You do something cool though and you may get a few more. XP will be given individually for traps, talking with people, finding key clues, etc. I will award some mad XP for anyone who gives me 15 minutes of solid roleplaying without breaking character. This will make the game more fun since it is an RPG (also see last paragraph)
  • I’m transitioning to Obsidian Portal as our campaign home. Use it to find info on places, people, or past events. You may even find something you didn’t know…
  • Each session, I will designate 1 person to write the adventure log after the session on here. It can be as fancy or brief as you want it to be. If you do it, you will get a bonus prize for the next session.
  • If you changed your avatar on here and sent me a PM with a magic item level 19-20 that you wanted, you will also receive that in our next session.
  • If you create a wiki page (ask how if you need) related to your character, I will also reward you for that. Example: Max creates a page for Haramathur under characters, detailing his background and the story of the four warforged, he will receive a bonus prize for that. For a prize on this one, the page must be well thought out.
  • Under the wiki tab we have pages called Party Treasury and Player Rewards. Player rewards will be where I place your rewards and XP. You will need to update the Party Treasury page with what you have acquired and spent.

I think our games can be so much better if we begin describing the environment (my job) and battles (our jobs) in a deeper and more vivid way. Also, outside of combat, remember that your options for what to do are near limitless. This is your world that you shape and can do anything in. Let’s get away from the usual “Metagame” thinking and start roleplaying more. Your decisions should be based on your character and less on what you as a real person would do. I’m going to do my best to facilitate this because I know it will make our games much more enjoyable and easily more epic.

* Lead by example with Roleplaying * Use magnetic whiteboard for initiative * Taunt indecisive players or ask "you can always use an at-will" or "would you like to delay?" * Ignore a lot of conditions or ongoing damage * Use average damage values if behind

• Lead by example with Roleplaying
  • Use magnetic whiteboard for initiative
  • Taunt indecisive players or ask “you can always use an at-will” or “would you like to delay?”
  • Ignore a lot of conditions or ongoing damage
  • Use average damage values if behind

[[:tathik-glodreddi | Tathik Glodreddi]] will collect a 1% tax on ALL treasures and belongings. "Sleepy" Fennik is a gnome quartermaster for the barracks. He can provide information on any guards or prisoners. *Treasure Seeking* [[:old-gaff | Old Gaff]] will be lingering around the gate market. He will gladly sell his treasure maps to incoming adventurers. *[[Stravalla's Tower | Stravalla's Tower]]* In the stables one of the stalls houses a white mare left here almost a decade ago by an eladrin paladin. The eladrin has long since disappeared. but he left behind enough cash to keep his mount in food and water for another twenty years. The horse is in fact a polymorphed eladrin prin· cess named Eldarea. Her tendency to kick at anyone who draws close to her is a sign ofher frustration at her predicament. Her champion. the eladrin paladin Baldyr, died seeking a cure for her condition from Queen Stravalla (see "Stravalla's Tower," page 6). Adventurers who recover the cure and save the princess can look forward to a handsome reward from her father, a powerful lord in the Feywild. prOVided that they can escort the petulant, demanding, and spoiled young woman back to his Feywild estate. page.title: Stravalla's Tower
page.content:
Just south of Mount Starris, a valley cuts a scarlike line through the Dawnforge Mountains. Despite the summer heat or the bitter winter cold, a forest forever thick and lush fills this valley. Travelers smell Summerdown Valley long before they see it, as the blooming flowers cast a perfume on the wind. Despite its appearance, the valley is a place of grave danger. A powerful hag, Queen Stravalla of Winter's Mourning, dwells within this place. In her crystal tower, she surveys the verdant garden that is her realm. Trolls, werewolves, and murderous fey heed her beck and call, and within the ever-verdant forest shamble the animated corpses of those who dared enter her realm. Clad in rusted armor and covered with sickly sweet orchids that grow from their decaying flesh, these sentinels make quick work of those who blunder into Summerdown Valley.
Blooming flowers cast a perfume on the wind as you notice a strangely fertile valley ahead. The thickness of the forest hides this tropical retreat. At the far end of the valley, a crystal tower rises just above the trees. A courtyard sits at the base of the tower with statues of a woman, acting as fountains supplying water to the surrounding brush. As you approach the fountains the brush on either side moves suddenly and you hear a deafening, howling sound. Two wolves leap from the brush and two werewolves emerge from behind the fountains. Inside the crystal tower, a faint cackling can be heard echoing thru the interior. The floor is grass just as outside and the tower reeks with humidity. Two crystal staircases flank an open garden and ascend, spiraling up to the second level. The ground begins to shake as three large creatures emerge from the dirt and attack. Atop the stairs is a large domed room filled with stone statues. Vines grow from the ceiling and from the statues. They crawl across the floor as well creating a kind of forest. An old woman is at the window at the far end of the room. She turns and lets out a hideous cackle as she disappears. The cackle echoes from all corners of the room and is joined by howling from all angles. _Each thunder attack from the hag destroys the nearest statue. Statues require a DC 23 strength check to break. After the Queen is defeated, the PCs will find a gold statuette of her on her desk (worth 1500 gp) along with a vile containing a pink liquid._

page.title: To Forgepeak
page.content:
There is a large door in the mountain with an arch constructed to look like a dragon. Light is emanating from inside. Inside a chandelier of candles flicker a dim light over the room. 3 Ogres are at various tables in the room. One stands and shouts, "Outsiders! What's your business here?" "Get out for your own good!" * 2 Ogre Savages MM199 * Ogre Skirmisher MM199 A dark stairwell leads deeper into the mountain and ends a fork. To the left, the smell of cooked meat is wafting thru the air. To the right, the sound of trickling water can be heard. # Stone dragon heads protrude from the walls. They act as fountains, channeling water from their mouthes into stone bowls. # This kitchen is warmer than the hallway. The stove is still warm and the smell of stew is thick in the air. The sound of laughter can be heard thru the wooden door in this room. Four dragonborn soldiers (MM86) sit eating at a table. If the door is opened, they all stand ready and one yells, "Outsiders! Give me one reason not to end your journey right here and now!" # This room smells of dust and bones as if it has not been opened in ages. A mangled skeleton lies in the corner wearing a gold helmet. # In this large room, an oni mage shouts praises to Gruumsh at an altar flanked by descending stairwells. Three ogres pay dues here as well. 3000gp are in a cloth sack on the altar as a gift to Gruumsh.
The stairs descend deeper into the mountain and the heat becomes intense. As you reach the bottom, the stairs meet on a large rock formation above boiling lava. You can hear the bubbling and popping of the lava a hundred feet below. Thar stands over the edge looking down. A griffon guards either side of him, each with a dragonborn rider. Two ogres also stand watch. Thar turns around and says in a mocking tone, "Look at this band of misfits. Just do me a favor. _Try_ and keep up." The griffons take flight and the fight begins.

page.title: Shadow Tomb
page.content: The plants around this tomb are all lifeless and the shadows do not appear as they should. A cold air can be felt near the entrance. A sarcophagus (requires strength DC 20 to move) sits alone inside the dark tomb. Stairs beneath lead down into darkness. # The room has two doors each with a descending staircase. The left door has a foul stench emanating from it. The right door smells of blood. # In this room, all torches go out. Green eyes appear in the darkness before attacking. The chest hidden behind the wights contains the Winged Boots (PH 247) # This room has coffins standing up against the walls. Paintings line the walls with portraits of rich looking men. A red carpet leads across the floor to the far end where a coffin lies upon a stone platform. A picture above it appears to be a gentlemen in a suit. As the PCs get closer, the picture turns into an evil vampire and the coffins swing open! The Vampire Lord was a human rogue and is wearing the magical Rogue's Gloves (PH 247) # There is a fountain in the middle of this room with a red substance running through it. There is a lavish floor rug and a chandelier.

The plants around this tomb are all lifeless and the shadows do not appear as they should. A cold air can be felt near the entrance. A sarcophagus (requires strength DC 20 to move) sits alone inside the dark tomb. Stairs beneath lead down into darkness.

  1. The room has two doors each with a descending staircase. The left door has a foul stench emanating from it. The right door smells of blood.
  2. In this room, all torches go out. Green eyes appear in the darkness before attacking. The chest hidden behind the wights contains the Winged Boots (PH 247)
  3. This room has coffins standing up against the walls. Paintings line the walls with portraits of rich looking men. A red carpet leads across the floor to the far end where a coffin lies upon a stone platform. A picture above it appears to be a gentlemen in a suit. As the PCs get closer, the picture turns into an evil vampire and the coffins swing open! The Vampire Lord was a human rogue and is wearing the magical Rogue’s Gloves (PH 247)
  4. There is a fountain in the middle of this room with a red substance running through it. There is a lavish floor rug and a chandelier.

page.title: Calastryx
page.content:
_The town of Hammerfast is in panic. The dragon screamed out of the mountain and down over the city before taking off into the wild. Citizens rush to buy supplies as a handful prepare to leave town. If the rumors are true, the dragon Calastryx will hunt in the wild for one day before returning to enact revenge upon Hammerfast. The town guard is meeting in the Gate Ward, the scribes and scholars meet in the Lore Ward, and the followers of Gruumsh remain at the Black Spire._ *Town Guard in the Gate Ward*
*Scholars in the Lore Ward*
*Gruumsh Followers at the Black Spire*

page.title: In search for the Tomb of Horrors
page.content:
_In Hammerfast, there is an unmarked tomb. Buried deep within it you will find a map. It is said to lead to the most dangerous place in the entire world. My bet is that that crazy eladrin is already on his way there, if not arrived already._
History DC 26 - A clan of dwarves from far away have guarded the secret within the tomb for ages. Only recently have orcs also taken up residence to guard it as well. The orcs from the Black Spire entered and struck a deal with the dwarves. They are not as strong or well organized but they can be found deep within the tomb nonetheless.
_The tomb is unmarked and a cool breeze flows from the entrance. Inside there is an open archway leading to a descending staircase. Down here, the floor is made of stone and the walls carved from the rock of the earth. It is cool and quiet. The hallway ends at a spiral staircase leading deeper into the earth. The door opens into a wide room surrounding a pool of water. Two doors flank a set of double doors on the opposite side. The double doors are locked (DC 35) and require two keys. A chest is also next to the railing._
*Encounter 1* 350 XP There is a Flame Jet Trap guarding this chest. (DMG 90) The chest contains three gems worth 1000gp each.
*Encounter 2* 1100 XP The orcs can be heard on the other side of the door. They are talking about the recent word of the dragon attacking Hammerfast. They are seated around a table. There are: 1 Orc Chieftain (MM 204) 4 Orc Warriors (MM 203)
*Encounter 3* 1500 XP There is a room with high ledges surrounding it. Archers sit atop the 20 foot walls. An alchemist with two guards are near the table at the other end. The alchemist has a key around his neck. 1 Orc Alchemist - 600 XP 2 Orc Warriors (MM 203) - 100 XP each 4 Orc Archers - 175 XP each The table has some useless chemicals, a bag of 500 GP, and a painting of Gruumsh adorns the wall above the table.
*Encounter 4* 200 XP Writings on the floor read in Dwarvish: "A name not spoken, a history forgotten. A nightmare lost forever in hopes of a better future. Those brave enough to speak it, shall enter." The answer is: Calastryx.
Encounter 5 The PCs enter a room full of mirrors. _As you enter, you notice the room is full of mirrors. You look at your reflections before realizing you are now looking out at your friends from within the mirror. A closer look and they are gone. You are now in a labyrinth, alone. It is dark and cold._
Each choker worth 600 XP Each minotaur worth 400 XP
Chests contain: Helm of the Eagle (PH 248) Adamantine Weapon Iron Ring of the Dwarf Lords (PH 251) Potion of Vitality x2
_Upon entering the double doors, a large corridor leads you to a grand room. Orcs and dwarves guard a doorway that leads down a hall. The hall appears to have a green glow to it._
*Encounter 6* 3450 XP

page.title: Greyhawk
page.content:
_As you awake from your rest, you remember that the portal beneath Hammerfast had taken you to a grotto. You can hear the sounds of rushing water nearby and the pool is about three feet deep. The water is cool and refreshing._
A DC 22 Perception check notices a sparkling area of the pool. When examined, the water ripples into the face of Aranil. The face has a message.
_Brave Adventurers, welcome to Greyhawk! Be not afraid of one of my own who may seek you out here. His words, although troubling, may provide direction to Starfire. Also, I have a messenger in the Astral Sea, providing me information of great value. I am piecing this puzzle together slowly and I will notify you all when I’ve made more progress. Lastly, I turn to you Baurus. The Dwarven city Minora, from which we met you, has vanished. If you can provide any insight please send word. Luck to you all, Aranil._
As the characters enter the wild, they run into the Eladrin and "Tomb of Horrors" begins! Refer to supplemental text.

page.title: Campaign 6-6-11
page.content:
_Before leaving Brightkeep, Aranil approaches you. “Adventurers! A gift from the people of the Fey for ridding us the evil from the Garden of Graves.” He motions towards two eladrin guards. They bring forth four saddled horses._ * The first horse is brown with a white mane. A green saddle adorns its back. * The second horse is brown with a black mane. A black saddle adorns its back. * The third is a white horse with a white mane. A blue saddle adorns its back. * The fourth horse is white with a black mane. A red saddle adorns its back.

page.title: Algoria
page.content:
A scroll was uncovered just north of the Nentir Vale discussing events recently in Algoria.
_We had been warned that Greyhawk had fallen to its power. We didn't listen. It came, as we knew it would. A hunger so fierce that all was left in desolation. Gauthak the brave rescued many a life the first day. I fear that my remaining behind will only lead to my death. But I know no other home than fateful Algoria._

A scroll was uncovered just north of the Nentir Vale discussing events recently in Algoria.

We had been warned that Greyhawk had fallen to its power. We didn’t listen. It came, as we knew it would. A hunger so fierce that all was left in desolation. Gauthak the brave rescued many a life the first day. I fear that my remaining behind will only lead to my death. But I know no other home than fateful Algoria.

The citizens of Algoria do not recognize Argarwane (the rightful heir to their throne). They do look strangely upon this odd cast of characters, though. Heroes are a rare occurrence these days.
*The Setting Sun* This tavern is upscale. The floors are made of stone and marble. Darion Grimshaw runs the place and acts as bartender. He knows everything and everyone in town but he doesn't give information freely. He's a loyal human. He'll talk all day and night about the fallen Nerathi Empire. _Freeblood 7's_ - This card and dice game is the most popular in the kingdom of Algoria. The PCs can bet in groups of 1000 gp. A roll of 10 or higher allows for an Bluff check against opponent's Insight. A successful bluff counts as 1 point. First to 5 points wins. A roll of 7 on the d20 is an automatic win. Jandrel Bloomspeak is the most feared Freeblood 7's player in the realm. His Insight check is + 18 and his Bluff check is +19.
*Medallion Castle* The high Lord Anobil first recognizes Argarwane. He asks him to join them in the council room. Greyhawk has been taken but by what it is not known. It has been long enough since the fall of the Nerathi Empire that everyone now fights for power. The Prince of Undeath works in the shadows for his return. The tieflings of Bael Turath are trying to rebuild their empire. It's time that man do the same. Rumors and whispers have reached their ears that a man builds a machine of unspeakable power. The council wishes to rebuild the Nerathi Empire and use Algoria as the foundation. _"What say you, King Argarwane?"_
_The warforged realizes what must be done. Chigaru had reason to believe that Starfire acquired the Infernal Horns of Bael Turath. Investigating that region could lead to more clues as well as get insight on the progress of the tiefling empire._
Lord Anobil states, "Your grace, would you have your coronation before you set out? Or shall it wait for your return to Algoria?" "Head south to the Dawnforge mountains. The people of Hammerfast should be knowledgeable enough to help you from there. But they are a stubborn breed of dwarves so it may take some convincing to acquire their help."
The PCs then begin the [[Journey to Bael Turath]]

The citizens of Algoria do not recognize Argarwane (the rightful heir to their throne). They do look strangely upon this odd cast of characters, though. Heroes are a rare occurrence these days.

The Setting Sun
This tavern is upscale. The floors are made of stone and marble. Darion Grimshaw runs the place and acts as bartender. He knows everything and everyone in town but he doesn’t give information freely. He’s a loyal human. He’ll talk all day and night about the fallen Nerathi Empire.
Freeblood 7’s – This card and dice game is the most popular in the kingdom of Algoria. The PCs can bet in groups of 1000 gp. A roll of 10 or higher allows for an Bluff check against opponent’s Insight. A successful bluff counts as 1 point. First to 5 points wins. A roll of 7 on the d20 is an automatic win. Jandrel Bloomspeak is the most feared Freeblood 7’s player in the realm. His Insight check is + 18 and his Bluff check is +19.

Medallion Castle
The high Lord Anobil first recognizes Argarwane. He asks him to join them in the council room.
Greyhawk has been taken but by what it is not known. It has been long enough since the fall of the Nerathi Empire that everyone now fights for power. The Prince of Undeath works in the shadows for his return. The tieflings of Bael Turath are trying to rebuild their empire. It’s time that man do the same. Rumors and whispers have reached their ears that a man builds a machine of unspeakable power. The council wishes to rebuild the Nerathi Empire and use Algoria as the foundation. “What say you, King Argarwane?”

The warforged realizes what must be done. Chigaru had reason to believe that Starfire acquired the Infernal Horns of Bael Turath. Investigating that region could lead to more clues as well as get insight on the progress of the tiefling empire.

Lord Anobil states, “Your grace, would you have your coronation before you set out? Or shall it wait for your return to Algoria?”
“Head south to the Dawnforge mountains. The people of Hammerfast should be knowledgeable enough to help you from there. But they are a stubborn breed of dwarves so it may take some convincing to acquire their help.”

The PCs then begin the Journey to Bael Turath

*Caves of Kaxhar* # _The entrance resembles a cave that looks half manmade. The cave follows to the right but it looks like a hallway was added on the left as well._ A perception check DC 25 will notice a crack in the rock to the right. It looks like a wooden door is behind the rock wall. DC 22 Strength check will break it down. # _There are three chests on a dais. An inscription on the wall reads, "The defender knows to claim his prize, or a ghostly death will soon arise._ The right chest has the prize. Either of the other chests will trigger a Spectral Tendrils trap DMG 91. # _This large room is adorned with an unfamiliar writing around the walls. Five humans stand at a set of double doors at the far end._ "This prize is ours! In the name of the White Lantern Consortium, I demand that you leave now!" If the PCs do not leave immediately, the humans attack. # _This room bears strange resemblance to a tomb. A dais sits in the middle of the room. At the far end, you see a stone sarcophagi with a small chest sitting atop it. The room is covered in dust and bones._ Once all the PCs are near the dais, or someone touches the sarcophagi read, _You hear a deep laughter as a three-headed skeleton manifests atop the dais and brings forth warriors from the bones._ # _Strange markings line the floor in this corridor._ The floor is an electrified trap. DMG 91. # _This large chamber is a natural cavern. There is one large column in the middle of the room. Lava flows from this column out an opening in the cavern and down the cliffside. The scent of this lava has a sting to it in addition to the immense heat it gives off._ The ruby dragon statuette is placed in a nook in the column. It radiates arcane energy. Once touched, the statue activates. _There is an explosion of blinding light from the statue. Lava begins to flow out from the column in various patterns across the floor. A large dragon manifests itself from the light and screams a bloodthirsty roar. A large demon also rises from the lava._ The treasure in the chest in the nook of the room is the "Defender's Armor."

page.title: Campaign 6-29-11
page.content:
Argarwane was greeted by a group of soldiers from Algoria. They escorted him back to his throne. A group of locals recognizes the group for their heroic efforts. During a tribal ceremony, Shadow is inscribed with the Tattoo of Vengeance as their thank you.
As they are leaving Vor Rukoth, a group lures them into an assassination attempt. They are followers of the Raven Queen. The assassins are dressed with her symbols and announce it. A Religion DC 22 knows the following: The name of the god of death is long forgotten, but she is called the Raven Queen. She is the spinner of fate and the patron of winter. She marks the end of each mortal life, and mourners call upon her during funeral rites, in the hope that she will guard the departed from the curse of undeath. She expects her followers to: * Hold no pity for those who suffer and die, for death is the natural end of life. * Bring down the proud who try to cast off the chains of fate. As the instrument of the Raven Queen, you must punish hubris where you find it. * Watch for the cults of Orcus and stamp them out whenever they arise. The Demon Prince of the Undead seeks to claim the Raven Queen’s throne.

Door 2 - _You see an underground dwarven city, trapped between the very planes of existence. The cries of the dwarves strike terror into your soul._
Door 3 - _A familiar kingdom lies before your eyes. Algoria. But it looks nothing like it did. Flames engulf the countryside and cities are in ruins. You can hear the cries of women and children._
Door 4 - _You can see Greyhawk. Suddenly, a large army, covered in darkness storms across it. The lands are filled with the darkness as it continues to grow. It strikes fear into your soul._

You can see King Heroldi, the dwarves of Hammerfast, Oaklord, the elves of the forest all reaching out to you. Yet they cannot reach you. Petendithas Oaklord holds a scroll in one hand that comes close to the surface beneath your feet, yet does not cross into the room. King Heroldi holds his hand out with a small statuette of a unicorn. It does not cross into the room either._ The scroll is obtainable. The same process will acquire the unicorn statuette. The inscription "Eluna" is upon it. When spoken, a unicorn will travel from the Feywild (once per extended rest) and accompany its owner.

Next thing you know, you are in the castle staring at a large window overlooking the city. A strange figure stands in front of it staring at the stars in wonderment. page.title: Quest for Quinn
page.content:
The PCs can gain the knowledge (Streetwise DC 24) that Quinn Morlin usually resides in Nenlast. Jarel Hammerthorn can lead them to Nenlast if they agree to guard his caravan along the way. It's about 40 miles from Hammerfast. It requires a day and a half of travel. The first 10 miles is on the King's Road. During this part of the journey, a wild storm arises over the road. A DC 20 Endurance check is required to not lose a healing surge. As the characters turn north from the King's Road, they are attacked.

h2. Places of Interest
*Hawk Tavern* - The most prominent tavern in Nenlast. Anyone of importance brings their business here. Many trade deals are struck at the card tables of the Hawk Tavern. They claim the best ale in the Nentir Vale as well.
*Nen Inn* - The PCs can stay here for a normal fee. The rooms only have 2 beds each. The owner, Malton Markelhay, is the cousin of the famous Fallcrest Markelhays. He knows just about everyone coming and going thru Nenlast.

page.title: Arna
page.content:
History concerning Arna... Arna, which translates to The Mossflower in the common tongue, is a large beautifully forested woodland area on the River Moss. Arna is divided in two by the River Moss, which can be crossed by several bridges or at the crossroads at Summerdell. It lies just south of the Northlands where the Vryloka's evil kin were banished to long ago, and to the west of [[Asalia | Asalia]]. Aside from the treachery of Kale the Cruel, Arna remains a place of harmony. Trade is frequent with the neighboring lands, festivals and tournaments of the lance and sword are held frequently in the countryside and the annual Tournament of Fire is held outside Haran, the Capitol of Arna. Arna is home to many of the best craftsmen, farmers and builders. When Kale the Cruel led the army out of Eriador, the Vampires he had sworn a truce with invaded the city. A resistance was led by the Prince Lomian, the Vampires were crushed and Kale the Cruel brought to justice.
Lomian's uncle and mentor, [[:cayne-dawnshadow | Cayne Dawnshadow]], now sits on the throne...hoping for Lomian's swift return.

page.title: Maetrage
page.content: Maetrage is known by all in Maransa as the Jewel in the Sand. All outside Maransa know it as the Cursed City. It is the largest city in Maransa and some say in all of Aestonia. The city is filled with vile creatures, gamblers, prostitutes, murderers, and it is rumored that beneath the city lies a direct channel to the Underdark. Maetrage is also home to a group known as [[The Rising Fall]]. !http://cdn.obsidianportal.com/assets/125378/Maetrage.jpg(Maetrage)!

Maetrage is known by all in Maransa as the Jewel in the Sand. All outside Maransa know it as the Cursed City. It is the largest city in Maransa and some say in all of Aestonia. The city is filled with vile creatures, gamblers, prostitutes, murderers, and it is rumored that beneath the city lies a direct channel to the Underdark. Maetrage is also home to a group known as The Rising Fall.

Maetrage indeed has a route to the Underdark. A small group of Drow patrol the entrance in secret. They alert those in their homeland of any unwelcome visitors. Maetrage is also home to a group known as [[The Rising Fall]]. They seek to gain enough power to overtake Maransa and then all of Aestonia. They have an intricate network of spies and adventurers alike.
# The [[Tower of Shan 'Aman]] The wizard's guild in Maetrage. # [[The Buka 'Ukan]] This marketplace is the largest slave trade in all Aestonia. Maransa is the only land where slavery is still socially accepted. # [[The Deepening Stalls]] This section of the city is a giant mine. Deep within, there are veins of precious [[Astia]]. The appearance is slightly run-down since mostly workers live here. As the mining projects progress further underground, the original structures become abandoned and broken. If one were to travel to the very deepest caverns, they would notice the structures get progressively nicer as they travel deeper. The current operator is [[:larg-axeforged | Larg Axeforged]]. Very few slaves are used here as Larg believes them to be less skilled than the miners.

page.title: Eriador
page.content:
An account of Karyn Wynn,
" ...Then they looked up and could see, and lo! they were at the foot of steep hills, and these hills made a great circle wherein lay a wide plain, and set therein, not rightly at the midmost but rather nearer to that place where they stood, was a great hill with a level top, and upon that summit rose a city in the new light of the morning..." "...But I looked upon the walls of stone, and the uplifted towers, upon the glistering pinnacles of the town, and looked upon the stairs of stone and marble, bordered by slender balustrades and cooled by the leap of fountains of Amon Galastre..."
An account of The Oath Breaker,
"...Then did the throng return within the gates and the wanderers with them, and I saw they were of iron and of great height and strength. Now the streets of Eriador were paved with stone and wide, curbed with marble, and fair houses and courts amid gardens of bright flowers were set about the ways, and many towers of great slenderness and beauty builded of white marble and carved most marvellously rose to the heaven. Squares there were lit with fountains and the home of birds that sang amid the branches of their aged trees, but of all these the greatest was that place where stood the king's palace, and the tower thereof was the loftiest in the city, and the fountains that played before the doors shot twenty fathoms and seven in the air and fell in a singing rain of crystal: therein did the sun glitter splendidly by day, and the moon most magically shimmered by night. The birds that dwelt there were of the whiteness of snow and their voices sweeter than a lullaby of music. On either side of the doors of the palace were two trees, one that bore blossom of gold and the other of silver, nor did they ever fade, for they were shoots of old from the glorious Trees of Old that lit those places before the Gloomweaver withered them..."

page.title: The Flushing Raynes
page.content:
*Below are the histories of the Flushing Raynes. Upon discoveries of vampires within the royal bloodline, the Cascades banded together and annihilated the family and most of its history. The lands were given to [[:matrius-highmount | Matrius Highmount]].*
The House of Rayne was once the greatest of the houses of Men, having at the time of their coming to this region, a fortune of both arms and gold beyond any mortals reckoning. "For the most part they were tall people, with flaxen or golden hair and blue-grey eyes, but there were not a few among them that had dark hair, though all were fair-skinned." The People of Rayne were "quick to wrath and laughter, fierce in battle, generous to friend and to foe, swift in resolve, fast in loyalty, joyous in heart, they were known as the Golden Ones in the youth of Mankind." They were akin to the house Morlin. The vanguard of the Greater Folk, now led by one Marach, were the first to reach the The Everwinter, but they were daunted by the heights and turned southward, seeking a way round the Mountains. Thus they came to Asalia from the North when the other Houses had already settled. Marach therefore led his people to the plains just below the Grey Mountains, where they settled to the east of the Folk of Aegrias, the dragonborn. The House of Rayne became the most renowned of the Cascades, fighting for the people of Aegrias and those of the Realm of the Vines to the west. They were moreover hardy to endure cold and feared not at times to go far into the north and there keep watch upon the movements of Vampiric forces. A great battle with an ancient house far in the north all but destroyed this once glorious house. The remnant of the House of Rayne was then put to thraldom; those able to work were taken to mines of the north or laboured as slaves for the Incomers, and the old were killed or driven out to starve. Vampiric' lordship under Morgothian lasted nearly a century, until the Host of the Heroldi arrived in the cascades and the War of Wrath began. The remnants of the Houses then fought on the side of Heroldi's Forces, and after the defeat of Morgothian, they were granted the Flushing Raynes to dwell in. The descendants of the House of Rayne composed the majority of its population. Most of the people of [[Asalia | Asalia]] and [[Stallcroft | Stallcroft]] was thus also descended from either the House of Rayne or those of their folk that never crossed the Blue Mountains. !http://cdn.obsidianportal.com/assets/128110/Flushing_Raynes.jpg(Flushing raynes)!

The Flushing Raynes have a few vampires within the royal family. They have no interest in the vampiric forces in the north but are corrupt and seek to expand their influence. They are actually very weak and not in a position of great power.

page.title: The Aegrias Prime
page.content:
h2. [[Aegrias Prime]]
!http://cdn.obsidianportal.com/assets/124040/Aegrias_Prime.jpg(Aegrias prime)!
Cross into the Cascades and travel far north. Look to the west underneath the Great Mountain Range and you will see the glory that is the Aegrias Prime. The sprawling stone estate lies at the base of a small mountain. Tunnels lead into the mountain from the rear of the estate. High walls surround the entire landholding. The towers and faces of stone resemble dragons in their making. Fit for a stronghold of dragonborn. The Aegrias bloodline goes as far back as the dragonborn race itself. Abraxus Aegrias first brought his family to Aestonia before the Nerathi Empire. Their former kingdom gave them the honor of starting a dragonborn settlement in a new land. Their former kingdom was also thrown into ruins shortly after, leaving the Aegrias family cut off and alone. Their spirits were as strong as their muscled backs though and they created an estate and wealth unimaginable. The current heir to Abraxus is [[:kriv-aegrias | Kriv Aegrias]]. The city is 90% dragonborn. The culture is strictly from the ancient dragonborn ways and everyone follows and respects that. The Aegrias family has provided a wealthy and safe home for ages and the occupants are more than happy to recognize this. The other 10% of the population is a mixture of humans, halflings, and dwarves. Few elves inhabit the city but can be found. A sprinkling of gnomes, goliaths, and other creatures are seen occasionally.

page.title: Inceptum Aestonia
page.content:
h4. A Story of Coming War by Legarius the Wise
*The Seat at Risencrest* It was always spoken, "He who holds the seat at Risencrest, holds reigns to all Aestonia." And thus, the seat at Risencrest is a most prized possession of power. Never has one throne claimed so many a king, so many a bloodline. Risencrest, settled firmly to the east of the Crested Downs, is a fortress. Protected to the east from Maransa by the Downs, and from the north by the Rising River, it remains one of the most difficult seats to acquire by force. And so our story begins not with war, but rather deceit and trickery. Threats from within are often deserved of the highest fear. *Marvella's Wonder* With King Blackstone (Laurent, first of his name) in charge of Risencrest, the Rising Lands were prosperous and expanding. Whispers of a new kingdom in the north did not bring about fear yet the talks of Maransa stole the king's sleep. Scouts had placed thousands of airship vessels in Maransa within the last tenday. Troops from somewhere in the Western Edge had also joined up in [[Maetrage | Maetrage]]. King Blackstone had his forces around Risencrest doubled and set forces at various hidden outposts across the Risen Lands. He expected war. Maransa had, after all, known nothing but evil in his eyes. Less than a tenday after his reinforcements, a strange woman dressed in gypsy garb arrived at the castle requesting an audience. Marvella was the name she gave. With her she brought only one gentlemen to pull her cart. He was the strangest of men. His green eyes tore deep into your soul and he spoke not a word. Marvella swore she could show the king his future if he would only repay her with a guarded caravan to her home in Maransa. The king, being on edge from his sleepless nights accepted the offer. A grave mistake that still haunts his bloodline. Marvella conjured a fine mist in his throne room while whispering words of an unknown past. As the king leaned in to view his future, he was pulled from his seat and sent into the mist. Accounts of guards in the room say that he turned to mist himself as his screaming faded from earshot. At once, the guards attacked but were rendered immobilized by the evil witch. She took the throne for herself. Troops entered the room to harness her only to find her strange friend transformed into a towering dragon. The king's troops were now hers. She executed the queen but the prince was no where to be found.

page.title: Risencrest
page.content: Often considered the most powerful seat in all of Aestonia. Tristan Blackstone is the current King of the Rising Lands and his seat is at Castle Blackstone in Risencrest. They are known for the finest clothing trade in all Aestonia as well as an impressive military force that often meets at the Bleeding Edge to fend of forces of Maransa.

Often considered the most powerful seat in all of Aestonia. Tristan Blackstone is the current King of the Rising Lands and his seat is at Castle Blackstone in Risencrest. They are known for the finest clothing trade in all Aestonia as well as an impressive military force that often meets at the Bleeding Edge to fend of forces of Maransa.

*Black District* This district is the slums. Buildings are wooden and falling apart with few people in the streets. Most avoid the area that do not live there. Littered with taverns, crooks, and thieves, this place is often sought out by those looking for key information. _The Crested Goat_ is the least shady of the taverns yet it is full of thieves and liars still. They have the finest ales in the Black District. _Harpoon's Willow_ is a newer tavern with growing popularity. The ale is decent but the crooks are plenty. This place is much more dangerous. [[:rustig-harpoon | Rustig Harpoon]] runs this place (and some say much more). *Common's District* This district holds most of the housing for the people of Risencrest. The buildings are wooden with a few stone and are well-kept. _The Tainted Kobold_ is a much more secretive but favorite tavern. _The Iron Dagger_ is the popular tavern among the district. The people here revere the brothers Malachai. [[:pieter-malachai | Pieter Malachai]] and his brother [[:jayson-malachai | Jayson Malachai]] are popular among the common-folk and often represent them in the courts of Castle Blackstone. These two nobles came from street-rats to noble status through their foiling of a Maransan spying network in Risencrest. They know better than any how the town works. *Market District* Here you can find most of the shops and markets. Wooden buildings that are welcoming cover this district. Markets here favor clothing above all else. Luxurious clothings from all over Aestonia can be found here and especially from the Nentir Vale. Other goods here include fresh foods, some armor and weapons, and a few magic goods. No prominent figures live here yet some places of interest include Podego's Linens, Yandar's Combat, and Silvar's Accessories.
!http://cdn.obsidianportal.com/assets/130675/Risencrest.jpg(Risencrest)!
The PCs must obtain a gold-crested, hand-signed charter from the King to bear arms and roam the countryside freely during times of war. This cost 1500gp.

Black District
This district is the slums. Buildings are wooden and falling apart with few people in the streets. Most avoid the area that do not live there. Littered with taverns, crooks, and thieves, this place is often sought out by those looking for key information. The Crested Goat is the least shady of the taverns yet it is full of thieves and liars still. They have the finest ales in the Black District. Harpoon’s Willow is a newer tavern with growing popularity. The ale is decent but the crooks are plenty. This place is much more dangerous. Rustig Harpoon runs this place (and some say much more).
Common’s District
This district holds most of the housing for the people of Risencrest. The buildings are wooden with a few stone and are well-kept. The Tainted Kobold is a much more secretive but favorite tavern. The Iron Dagger is the popular tavern among the district. The people here revere the brothers Malachai. Pieter Malachai and his brother Jayson Malachai are popular among the common-folk and often represent them in the courts of Castle Blackstone. These two nobles came from street-rats to noble status through their foiling of a Maransan spying network in Risencrest. They know better than any how the town works.
Market District
Here you can find most of the shops and markets. Wooden buildings that are welcoming cover this district. Markets here favor clothing above all else. Luxurious clothings from all over Aestonia can be found here and especially from the Nentir Vale. Other goods here include fresh foods, some armor and weapons, and a few magic goods. No prominent figures live here yet some places of interest include Podego’s Linens, Yandar’s Combat, and Silvar’s Accessories.

The PCs must obtain a gold-crested, hand-signed charter from the King to bear arms and roam the countryside freely during times of war. This cost 1500gp.

page.title: Grennal
page.content: Deep within the Realm of the Vines lies the elven city of Grennal. Newer is this city than the fabled ancient city of [[Raignoria]]. Still, high ranking elves of the forest make their home here. Some say that King [[:antoban-heroldi | Antoban Heroldi]] has his lineage from here. His mother's brother, [[:rolen | Rolen]] is one of the highest elves in this part of the Realm of the Vines. Near Grennal, rumors are that the Feywild will cross over into parts of the Realm that are this enchanted...

page.title: Seat of Leorand
page.content:
!http://cdn.obsidianportal.com/assets/124042/SeatofLeorand.jpg(Seatof leorand)!
Seek you the evil in tieflings? Seek you their devilish ways? Then steer clear of House Leorand. These tieflings have been around since the rise of the Nerathi Empire. Yet, they despise the tiefling race outside their own family. They spat upon the whispers of Bael Turath. Life is hard being an honest tiefling. But the Leorand clan have held strong and gathered great wealth. Rumors speak of magic in this estate. The Seat of Leorand is supposedly home to some of the finest wizards and warlocks in all Aestonia. Alas, rumors tend to be a bit far-fetched in these regions...

Their prime threat is the dragonborn of the Aegrias Prime, although, the Raynes are very interested in the magical secrets of the Seat of Leorand.
